intro: Anchusa stoechadifolia, commonly known as the Scottish bugloss, is a perennial herb native to the British Isles and parts of northern Europe. It is characterized by its blue to purple flowers and lance-shaped leaves, which are typically hairy. The plant grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its medicinal and ornamental plants. Anchusa stoechadifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and has historical uses in herbal medicine.
